fields.description:
The euca_conf --deregister-service command often gives an error but the result of the operation is a success. If you describe immediately after the operation returns you will sometimes see API_\*.euare and API_\*.tokens are still enabled but they go away in a moment or so.

Steps:
# register a new UFS host ex. {{euca_conf --register-service -T user-api --host 10.111.1.174 -N API_174}}
# check services are enabled
# deregister UFS ex.{{euca_conf --deregister-service -T user-api -N API_174}}
# wait, wait, wait, error is reported
# check describe services, you may catch that some of the user services are still listed and enabled
# check again a minute later and everything is as expected and UFS are all deregistered

output
{code}
[root@g-19-11 ~]# euca_conf --deregister-service -T user-api -N API_174
error: deregistration failed
ERROR	Failed to deregister user-api: API_174 because of : Failed to lookup any registered component with the name: API_174
{code}

!https://s3.amazonaws.com/f.cl.ly/items/0H3C37323O3s1y3M3F1H/WeinerDog.jpg|align=center, vspace=4!

Full sequence of register/describe/deregister/describe
{code}

comments.body:
The error occurs due to the client timing out after 70 seconds and then retrying the deregistration. You can modify the timeout by creating a "~/.boto" file:

{code}
[Boto]
http_socket_timeout = 600
{code}

There are a few issues with service deregistration:

* We first register services on deregistration (typo/copy-paste error)
* During deregistration the regular topology checks are also trying to enable services and blocking progress
* Service updates are dispatched to other hosts serially

When these issues are addressed deregistration takes 50 seconds rather than minutes (with 5 UFS hosts):

https://github.com/sjones4/eucalyptus/commit/57d1b2c6c6cba933344956ea86e95d9884a1e31b
https://github.com/sjones4/eucalyptus/commit/c938fc3eadc34d859ec529d7bf14f27024c51830

The fix touches areas with high risk for regressions and is currently running through QA.

[~sjones], would be good to understand if there's an easy way to just change the timeout for now and get the fix in for 4.0.1.   Is that a relatively simple change?  I'm worried on the regression potential.

[~tjcramer], we could modify the timeout for this admin command (euca_conf --deregister-service / euca-deregister-service), but note that deregistering one user-api service group was taking over five minutes in my testing and there may be several to deregister.

[~sjones]

Is there any benefit to having only the first fix?
[~viglesias], I don't think there is any benefit to the first fix in terms of the time taken to deregister a service.

QA run for the above fixes:

http://10.111.1.120/euca-qa/display_test.php?testname=sjones-EUCA-9429&uid=1003

This issue was previously scheduled to be worked on in more than one sprint:
* '3.3 Sprint 4' (on board 'Test 3.3 Board')
* '3.3 Sprint 4' (on board 'Copy of 3.3 Release Board')

Starting from JIRA Agile 6.3, an issue can only belong to a single future sprint. Read more about this change: http://docs.atlassian.com/agile/docs-0640/Sprint+Marker+Migration

This issue is now scheduled for future sprint '3.3 Sprint 4' (on board 'Copy of 3.3 Release Board').

If this is incorrect, please update the issue accordingly.

This comment was automatically generated by JIRA. If it is no longer relevant, please feel free to delete it.

Fix Verified.

No error is reported when deregistering user-api and the time taken is under 1 minutes (somewhere near 30 sec)

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.0.1
Release     : 0.0.22216.18.20140710gitd416042.el6
